body: Please explain the bug in details. And provide a minimal repro or at least steps to produce.

> Please explain the bug in details. And provide a minimal repro or at least steps to produce.

@amrbashir I set the window to be centered, and the program will quickly move from a non centered position to the centered position when it starts

we need to center the position before creating the window but in order to do this we need to get a handle to the monitor the window wants to be displayed on, so we need to wait until tao implement this https://github.com/tauri-apps/tao/issues/187
Alternatively I think you could initially hide the window, then center it, and then show it.

issue.title: [bug] WindowBuilder's .maximized not working on Windows 10

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

labels.name: status: needs repro
labels.description: This issue needs to a minimal complete and reproducible example

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Using the WindowBuilder's [.maximized()](https://docs.rs/tauri/latest/tauri/window/struct.WindowBuilder.html#method.maximized) opens the window as a tiny window on Windows while it works fine on Linux (and acts weird on macOS, separate issue).

### Reproduction

```
WindowBuilder::new(
    app_handle,
    "main", 
    tauri::WindowUrl::App("index.html".into())
    ).center()
    .maximized(true)
    .build()
    .unwrap()
```


### Expected behavior

Window opens up maximized.

### Platform and versions

```text
Build environment (github CI):

[✘] Environment
    - OS: Windows 10.0.17763 X64
    ✘ Webview2: not installed!
      Visit https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/webview2/
    ✔ MSVC: Visual Studio Enterprise 2019
    ✔ rustc: 1.73.0 (cc66ad468 2023-10-03)
    ✔ Cargo: 1.73.0 (9c4383fb5 2023-08-26)
    ✔ rustup: 1.26.0 (5af9b9484 2023-04-05)
    ✔ Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc (directory override for 'D:\a\wordcondenser-standalone\wordcondenser-standalone')
    - node: 16.20.2
    - yarn: 1.22.19
    - npm: 8.19.4

[-] Packages
    - tauri [RUST]: 1.5.1
    - tauri-build [RUST]: 1.5.0
    - wry [RUST]: 0.24.4
    - tao [RUST]: 0.16.4
    - tauri-cli [RUST]: not installed!
    - @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: not installed!
    - @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.5.1 (outdated, latest: 1.5.2)

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - distDir: ../dist
    - devPath: ../dist
```
The bug then occurs on a Windows 10 PC.
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

Before submitting a PR, please read https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(windows): fix race condition in event loop
    - docs: update docstrings
    - feat: add `Window::set_fullscreen`

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. If there is a related issue, reference it in the PR text, e.g. closes #123.
3. If this change requires a new version, then add a change file in `.changes` directory with the appropriate bump, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.changes/readme.md
4. Ensure that all your commits are signed https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits
5. Ensure `cargo test` and `cargo clippy` passes.
6. Propose your changes as a draft PR if your work is still in progress.
-->
